titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require that in any case in which military law enforcement officials officers are called to a scene of domestic violence at which a weapon is present or there has been obvious physical violence that the officials shall arrest the individual who appears to have committed the offense.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Forces and Personnel.

bill.summary: 6/23/1993--Introduced. Requires a military law enforcement official at the scene of domestic violence to apprehend a person upon reasonable belief that such person has either inflicted physical injury or used a deadly or dangerous weapon or instrument.
